intro: Matelea carmenaemiliae, commonly known as Carmen's candleflower, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive, candle-like shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
